homes_hear_details: Vermont has launched its HOMES and HEAR rebate programs under the Inflation Reduction Act. Efficiency Vermont, the state's energy efficiency utility, is a key partner in administering these programs alongside the Vermont Department of Public Service, providing rebates for whole-home efficiency and high-efficiency electric equipment.

income_thresholds.low_income_80_ami: For Vermont, 80% of Area Median Income varies by county. In Chittenden County (Burlington), 80% AMI for a family of four is approximately $73,200. In Rutland County, it is approximately $60,400.
income_thresholds.moderate_income_150_ami: For Vermont, 150% of Area Median Income varies by county. In Chittenden County (Burlington), 150% AMI for a family of four is approximately $137,250. In Rutland County, it is approximately $113,250.

net_metering: Vermont has a robust net metering program for systems up to 500 kW. Residential customers receive credit for excess generation at a rate that includes an adjustor based on siting and technology. Credits can be carried forward indefinitely. Vermont's net metering rules are among the most favorable in the country.

state_tax_credits.name: Vermont Sales Tax Exemption for Renewable Energy
state_tax_credits.amount: 100% exemption from Vermont's 6% sales and use tax on renewable energy equipment
state_tax_credits.eligible_items: Solar photovoltaic panels, solar hot water systems, wind turbines, and other renewable energy generation equipment
state_tax_credits.details: Vermont exempts sales of renewable energy equipment from the state sales and use tax, reducing the upfront cost of installation.

state_rebate_programs.name: Efficiency Vermont Residential Programs
state_rebate_programs.administrator: Efficiency Vermont (operated by Vermont Energy Investment Corporation - VEIC)
state_rebate_programs.amount: Up to $3,000 for heat pumps, up to $4,000 for weatherization, $300-$800 for heat pump water heaters, $50-$200 for appliances
state_rebate_programs.eligible_items: Cold-climate heat pumps (ductless and ducted), insulation, air sealing, heat pump water heaters, smart thermostats, ENERGY STAR appliances, windows
state_rebate_programs.details: Efficiency Vermont is the nation's first statewide energy efficiency utility. It provides rebates, technical assistance, and financing options for residential energy efficiency improvements. Enhanced rebates are available for income-qualifying households.

state_rebate_programs.name: Weatherization Assistance Program
state_rebate_programs.amount: Average expenditure of approximately $8,500 per home
state_rebate_programs.eligible_items: Insulation, air sealing, heating system repair or replacement, windows, doors, health and safety improvements
state_rebate_programs.details: Federally funded program for income-qualifying households at or below 200% of federal poverty level. Administered through community action agencies.

programs.name: GMP Bring Your Own Device Program
programs.amount: Up to $1,000 rebate for battery storage, discounted Tesla Powerwall at $5,500
programs.eligible_items: Home battery storage systems (Tesla Powerwall, Enphase, etc.) that participate in grid peak management

programs.name: GMP Heat Pump Programs
programs.amount: Additional utility incentives stacked with Efficiency Vermont rebates
programs.eligible_items: Cold-climate heat pumps for space heating and cooling

programs.name: GMP EV Charging Rebate
programs.amount: Up to $400 for Level 2 home EV charger
programs.eligible_items: Level 2 (240V) home electric vehicle charging stations

programs.name: Residential Efficiency Programs
programs.amount: Varies; coordinates with Efficiency Vermont rebates
programs.eligible_items: Heat pumps, insulation, ENERGY STAR appliances, heat pump water heaters

programs.name: BED Residential Rebates
programs.amount: Additional incentives beyond Efficiency Vermont, varies by measure
programs.eligible_items: Heat pumps, heat pump water heaters, insulation, weatherization, EV chargers
